source.guidance:
Bash allows us to test regular expressions in if statements using double square brackets `[[ ]]`. The solution to this problem can be found below.

```
loginReport=11_27_2020_login_report.csv
if [[ $loginReport =~ ^[0-9]{2}_([0-9]{2})_(login)_report.csv$ ]];
then
  mv "$loginReport" Q4_LoginReports
fi
```
source.initial:
#!/bin/bash
loginReport=11_27_2020_login_report.csv
if [[$loginReport =~ //^//[0-9]//{2//}_([0-9]{2})_(login)_report.csv$]];
then
  mv "$loginReport" Q4_LoginReports
fi
mkdir "$loginReport" Q4_LoginReports#distractor
if (($loginReport =~ ^[0-9]{2}_([0-9]{2})_(login)_report.csv$));#distractor
source.instructions:
### Arrange the blocks to create a script that: - Defines a variable `loginReports` - Checks to see if `loginReports` matches our defined pattern for this file. - If it does match, move the file into a folder named `Q4_LoginReports **Note:** Indention matters in this exercise. Please indent correctly.

Click the button below to submit.

---
source.name: Regular Expressions: Regexes with IF statements
